name: Introduction to Humanities
description: Introduction to the principles of Humanities, including history, literature, art, music, philosophy, and religion.

name: History of Media Studies
description: Overview of Media Studies from its origins to the present, including the major developments such as the printing press, radio, television, and the internet.

name: Media Theory
description: Introduction to the theories, concepts, and debates that shape Media Studies, including semiotics, media ecology, and critical media theory.

name: Media Production
description: Introduction to the principles of media production, including writing for media, photography, video production, and audio production.

name: Media Criticism
description: Introduction to the theories and methods of media criticism, including textual analysis, audience reception, and genre studies.

name: History of Media Technology
description: Overview of the history of media technology, including the development of different media forms and their impact on culture and society.

name: Advanced Media Production
description: Advanced concepts of media production, including storytelling for media, cinematography, and audio engineering.
